def.dt: :having the color of the clear sky a blue house/car/shirt/pen his bright blue eyes the deep blue ocean see also baby blue black-and-blue cobalt blue navy blue royal blue sky blue true-blue
:sad or unhappy Are you feeling blue? see also blues

dt.snote: If you do something until you are blue in the face, you do it for a very long time without having any success or making any difference. I talked to him until I was blue in the face, but he wouldn't listen to me.

def.sl: of a person or body part
def.dt: :blue from being exposed to cold for too long Her hands and feet are blue with cold. He was shivering and blue from the cold.
:to turn blue from being cold or not breathing The baby stopped breathing and went blue.
:to talk rapidly and without stopping Sheesh! Your friend really talks a blue streak!

:the color of the clear sky noncount Her favorite color is blue. shades of blue He was dressed in blue. [=blue clothing] The sky was overcast, but here and there I could see a patch of blue. [=blue sky] count a mixture of blues and greens see color picture on page C1
:the sky or the sea They sailed off into the blue.
:without warning :in a surprising or unexpected way Then, out of the blue, he sold his house and left the country.
:a baby that has bluish skin usually because its heart is not working correctly
:membership in a royal or socially important family a woman of blue blood
:a member of a royal or socially important family This is where the city's blue bloods like to gather.

utxt.vi: blue-blooded sports like golf and polo

def.dt: :a report that is published by the government The information is listed in the blue book.
:a thin booklet with a blue cover and empty pages that is often used for writing the answers to test questions in college
:a book that lists the current value of items (such as used cars)
:a kind of cheese that is white with lines of blue mold and that has a strong flavor
:valuable and likely to make a good profit :not likely to cause investors to lose money blue-chip companies/stocks
:very good :excellent a blue-chip [=first-class, first-rate] artist/athlete/wine

:requiring physical work blue-collar jobs [=jobs making things in a factory, fixing machines, building things, etc.] :relating to or having jobs that require physical work blue-collar [=working-class] workers/families compare pink-collar white-collar
:a common American bird that is mostly blue see color picture on page C9
:pants made of a strong blue cloth (called denim) He was wearing (a pair of) blue jeans. see color picture on page C14
